com.cubeia.firebase.api.service.chat
Interface ChatFilter

All Superinterfaces:
Contract
public interface ChatFilter
extends Contract

This service contract should be implemented by filtering software. If a chat filter is deployed it will be used by the chat modules on each node in a cluster. This is a so-called plugin service which will only be used if deployed.

Implementors should note that the channelCreated(int, int) and channelDestroyed(int) methods are not guaranteed to be atomic across multiple virtual machines. In effect, it is possible to get multiple creation/destruction events for any given channel. This should be fairly uncommon though.

Author:
Larsan

Method Summary
 void channelCreated(int playerId, int channelId)
          A channel has been registered on a particular node by a connection registered with a particular user.
 void channelDestroyed(int channelId)
          This method will be invoked when a channel is dropped on a particular node.

          This method can be used to filter or modify a given table chat action.
 

Method Detail

channelCreated

void channelCreated(int playerId,
                    int channelId)
A channel has been registered on a particular node by a connection registered with a particular user. This method is not atomic across multiple virtual machines. It is possible, however unlikely, that this method may be called multiple times but on different nodes, under high concurrency situations.

Parameters:
playerId - Player that requested the channel, or -1 if not known
channelId - The new channel id

filter

ChannelChatAction filter(ChannelChatAction action)
This method can be used to filter or modify a given chat action. It can also completely replace a given action. The chat channel will use the return of this method for further processing. If the action should be dropped, this method should return null.

Parameters:
action - The action to filter, never null
Returns:
The action to continue with, or null to drop the action

filter

TableChatAction filter(TableChatAction action)
This method can be used to filter or modify a given table chat action. It can also completely replace a given action. The table chat will use the return of this method for further processing. If the action should be dropped, this method should return null.

Parameters:
action - The action to filter, never null
Returns:
The action to continue with, or null to drop the action

channelDestroyed

void channelDestroyed(int channelId)
This method will be invoked when a channel is dropped on a particular node. This method is not atomic across multiple virtual machines. It is possible, however unlikely, that this method may be called multiple times but on different nodes, under high concurrency situations.

Parameters:
channelId - The dropped channel id
